intro: Languas scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf plant, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and yellow-orange flower heads that resemble daisies. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
